message.content:
cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.CV

The paper proposes a technology for watching videos at high speed while preserving the entertainment value of the content. This involves controlling the speed of playback depending on the context of the video, such as segments with or without language. The paper also proposes features for displaying subtitles to reduce fatigue when watching high-speed video. Based on these aspects, the most likely sub-category is Multimedia (cs.MM), followed by Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC). The paper also involves natural language processing for handling subtitles, which could place it in Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) or Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-categories.
